meanings.sent1: The overpressure in the balloon caused it to burst.
meanings.sent2: The overpressure in the tire made it unsafe to drive.
meanings.sent3: The overpressure in the soda can made it fizz everywhere when opened.
meanings.sent4: The overpressure in the room was palpable, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The overpressure in the water pipe led to a sudden leak, flooding the basement.

meanings.sent1: Please do not overpressure the fragile glassware.
meanings.sent2: If you overpressure the pump, it might break.
meanings.sent3: He tends to overpressure the brakes, causing them to wear out quickly.
meanings.sent4: She felt like life was overpressuring her with too many responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the players not to overpressure themselves before the big game.

meanings.definition: A condition of being subjected to excessive pressure.
meanings.sent1: The workers were under overpressure due to the tight deadline.
meanings.sent2: The overpressure on the students to perform well was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The overpressure on the elevator made it stop between floors.
meanings.sent4: The overpressure on the team led to a lot of stress and tension.
meanings.sent5: The overpressure on the dam caused concerns about its structural integrity.
